segment.source: About Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.6 SP2
segment.target: About Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.6 SP2

segment.source: About Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.6 SP2
segment.target: About Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.6 SP2

segment.source: About Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.6 SP2
segment.target: About Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.6 SP2

segment.source: Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.6 SP2 provides several enhancements and new features, which are described in this topic.
segment.target: Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.6 SP2 provides several enhancements and new features, which are described in this topic.

segment.source: Caution
segment.target: Caution

segment.source: This topic describes how to change the Windows registry by using Registry Editor.
segment.target: This topic describes how to change the Windows registry by using Registry Editor.

segment.source: If you change the Windows registry incorrectly, you can cause serious problems that might require you to reinstall Windows.
segment.target: If you change the Windows registry incorrectly, you can cause serious problems that might require you to reinstall Windows.

segment.source: You should make a backup copy of the registry files (System.dat and User.dat) before you change the registry.
segment.target: You should make a backup copy of the registry files (System.dat and User.dat) before you change the registry.

segment.source: Microsoft cannot guarantee that the problems that might occur when you change the registry can be resolved.
segment.target: Microsoft cannot guarantee that the problems that might occur when you change the registry can be resolved.

segment.source: Change the registry at your own risk.
segment.target: Change the registry at your own risk.

segment.source: Support for Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Support for Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012

segment.source: App-V 4.6 SP2 adds support for Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012 Remote Desktop Services.
segment.target: App-V 4.6 SP2 adds support for Windows 8 and Windows Server 2012 Remote Desktop Services.

segment.source: Support for coexistence with App-V 5.0 client
segment.target: Support for coexistence with App-V 5.0 client

segment.source: App-V 4.6 SP2 provides support for coexistence with the Microsoft Application Virtualization 5.0 client.
segment.target: App-V 4.6 SP2 provides support for coexistence with the Microsoft Application Virtualization 5.0 client.

segment.source: Review the App-V 5.0 documentation for instructions on how to configure the App-V 5.0 client for coexistence with the App-V 4.6 SP2 client.
segment.target: Review the App-V 5.0 documentation for instructions on how to configure the App-V 5.0 client for coexistence with the App-V 4.6 SP2 client.

segment.source: For more information about App-V 5.0, see Application Virtualization 5 on TechNet.
segment.target: For more information about App-V 5.0, see Application Virtualization 5 on TechNet.

segment.source: Ability to virtualize Adobe Reader X with Protected Mode
segment.target: Ability to virtualize Adobe Reader X with Protected Mode

segment.source: You can virtualize Adobe Reader X with its Protected Mode feature turned on by using the following procedures.
segment.target: You can virtualize Adobe Reader X with its Protected Mode feature turned on by using the following procedures.

segment.source: Previously you had to disable Protected Mode in order to virtualize Adobe Reader X.
segment.target: Previously you had to disable Protected Mode in order to virtualize Adobe Reader X.

segment.source: Before launching the App-V Sequencer, create the following registry value under HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWARE MicrosoftSoftGrid4.5SystemGuardOverrides:
segment.target: Before launching the App-V Sequencer, create the following registry value under HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWARE MicrosoftSoftGrid4.5SystemGuardOverrides:

segment.source: Name
segment.target: Name

segment.source: Type
segment.target: Type

segment.source: Data
segment.target: Data

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: EnableVFSPassthrough
segment.target: EnableVFSPassthrough

segment.source: DWORD
segment.target: DWORD

segment.source: Set this value to 1 in order to start Adobe Reader X in Protected Mode during the launch phase.
segment.target: Set this value to 1 in order to start Adobe Reader X in Protected Mode during the launch phase.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: On a computer running a 64-bit operating system, create the registry value under HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeMicrosoftSoftGrid4.5SystemGuardOverrides.
segment.target: On a computer running a 64-bit operating system, create the registry value under HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeMicrosoftSoftGrid4.5SystemGuardOverrides.

segment.source: For each OSD-file in your Adobe Reader X package, add the following items under the POLICIES element:
segment.target: For each OSD-file in your Adobe Reader X package, add the following items under the POLICIES element:

segment.source: New Sequencer command-line parameter
segment.target: New Sequencer command-line parameter

segment.source: When you create a Package Accelerator (PA) through the Sequencer GUI, you can select an RTF or TXT file that provides packaging and deployment guidance to the administrators who will apply the Package Accelerator.
segment.target: When you create a Package Accelerator (PA) through the Sequencer GUI, you can select an RTF or TXT file that provides packaging and deployment guidance to the administrators who will apply the Package Accelerator.

segment.source: This functionality is now available using the Sequencer CLI.
segment.target: This functionality is now available using the Sequencer CLI.

segment.source: Specify a path to an RTF or TXT file that provides packaging and deployment guidance when creating a Package Accelerator.
segment.target: Specify a path to an RTF or TXT file that provides packaging and deployment guidance when creating a Package Accelerator.

segment.source: Microsoft Application Error Reporting no longer needs to be installed
segment.target: Microsoft Application Error Reporting no longer needs to be installed

segment.source: When you are installing the App-V 4.6 SP2 client by using setup.msi, you no longer need to install Microsoft Application Error Reporting (dw20shared.msi).
segment.target: When you are installing the App-V 4.6 SP2 client by using setup.msi, you no longer need to install Microsoft Application Error Reporting (dw20shared.msi).

segment.source: App-V 4.6 SP2 now uses Microsoft Error Reporting.
segment.target: App-V 4.6 SP2 now uses Microsoft Error Reporting.

segment.source: For more information, see How to Install the App-V Client by Using Setup.msi.
segment.target: For more information, see How to Install the App-V Client by Using Setup.msi.

segment.source: Customer feedback and hotfix rollup
segment.target: Customer feedback and hotfix rollup

segment.source: App-V 4.6 SP2 includes a rollup of fixes to address issues found since the App-V 4.6 SP1 release.
segment.target: App-V 4.6 SP2 includes a rollup of fixes to address issues found since the App-V 4.6 SP1 release.

segment.source: App-V 4.6 SP2 contains the latest fixes up to and including Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.6 SP1 Hotfix 6.
segment.target: App-V 4.6 SP2 contains the latest fixes up to and including Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.6 SP1 Hotfix 6.

segment.target: Provides the most up-to-date information about known issues with App-V 4.6 SP2.
